SDS 325H (Honors Statistics) • Spring 2015 • MW 11:00 - 12:30, FAC 101B
Instructor: James Scott (james.scott@mccombs.utexas.edu)

Week 1 (January 21, 2015)

January 18, 2015

On the first day of class, we talk briefly about the perils of causal reasoning using data. Key concepts:
* confounding
* dependence graphs
* blinding and placebos
* longitudinal and cross-sectional studies
* natural experiments
